attributes.action: Ruislip, Northwood & Pinner ask the Government  to grant a free vote on A50 Bill
attributes.additional_details: Under the MPs code of conduct III. 5, 6 and 7 he is obliged to put the best interests of the UK and his constituents first.  Unless a free vote is granted he will be required to break the Whip to support us. A free vote would allow him to demonstrate to us that he is deserving of our future vote in any subsequent election.
attributes.background: We the People of Ruislip, Northwood and Pinner petition the Government to allow a free vote in the House of Commons on the A50 Bill. An estimated 70% of us voted to remain in the EU and we believe our MP should be given the opportunity to show his support for his constituents.

rejection.details: This is the responsibility of political parties, not the Government or Parliament.
